intro: Calochortus howellii, commonly known as Howell's mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes various species of flowering plants commonly referred to as mariposa lilies. This particular species is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped blooms that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. Calochortus howellii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands, woodlands, and along streambanks.
